author: PETE CALDERA
title: Yankees notes: Nathan Eovaldi wants a shot to pitch in postseason - Baseball
text:
BALTIMORE — Nathan Eovaldi is aiming to be available as a reliever should the Yankees advance beyond the wild card.
Buy this photo ASSOCIATED PRESS Nathan Eovaldi wants to be a postseason reliever if the Yankees win the wild card game. "Everything feels great," Eovaldi said after a 25-pitch bullpen session – 18 fastballs, seven splitters – on Friday at Camden Yards.
Sidelined since Sept. 7 with right elbow inflammation, Eovaldi (14-3, 4.20 ERA) isn't ready for inclusion on Tuesday's wild card roster, but the hard-throwing right-hander could be a factor in a best-of-five division series.
"Anything I can do to help the team win," said Eovaldi, who will conduct another bullpen session on Monday. As for making the quick transition from starting, "I've always been able to get ready real quick. I don't feel like it'd be an issue."
HELD BACK: Infielder Stephen Drew has been diagnosed with a vestibular concussion and is doubtful to return.
Manager Joe Girardi said that Drew remained in New York over the weekend. Drew hasn't played in any of the Yankees' past nine games because of dizziness and trouble focusing.
"For right now it's doubtful because still hasn't been playing," Girardi said of the chances of Drew playing anytime soon.
While awaiting test results, Drew accurately surmised that he was dealing with concussion symptoms related to an inner-ear imbalance.
Drew believes it's tied to a cocktail of circumstances; a 2013 concussion that impacted his vestibular system, nasal congestion and a grounder that deflected off his face in a recent game.
GAME ON: Lefty reliever Chasen Shreve's confidence might be shaken after an awful September, but "we're going to use him the next couple of days to try to get him back on track," Girardi said.
"Is it possible I could use him [today] and Sunday and see if we could get [his] mojo back? Absolutely."
Over his past eight games (4 2/3 innings), Shreve has yielded seven runs on 13 hits – four of them homers – with five walks.
